Meanwhile, peel and core apples. Slice apples into 1/3' thick wedges; toss with some of the lemon juice in a bowl. Peel cooled sweet potatoes, and slice 1/3' thick. Arrange potatoes and apples alternately in a greased 13' x 9' baking dish. Pour remaining lemon juice over potatoes and apples. Combine brown sugar and the next 6 ingredients in a saucepan, stirring well. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally; boil 2 minutes or until slightly thickened. Pour glaze over potatoes and apples. Bake, uncovered, at 400°F for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven; baste with glaze from the bottom of the dish, and sprinkle nuts across top. Bake for 14 to 15 more minutes or until apples look roasted. Baste with glaze again just before serving.

side.title: Spätzle
side.instructions: Mix flour and salt in a bowl. Add eggs and mix well. Gradually add just enough water to make a smooth, light, and firm dough. The amount will depend on how 'dry' your flour is. It’s best to mix for 10 minutes with a wooden spoon or dough hook. Let stand for 10 minutes. Meanwhile bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Push dough through the Spätzle maker with the scraper, directly into the boiling water. The spätzle will float when they are done (this will take a few minutes). Remove them with a slotted spoon. These are often served with 1) gravy, 2) buttered and browned breadcrumbs (Homer traditional way), 3) lightly sautéed diced bacon, 4) fried onions.

side.title: Sweet Potato and Apple Scallop
ingredients: 2 C thinly sliced boiled sweet potatoes (about 2 medium)
1 1/2 C peeled, thinly sliced tart apples (McIntosh, Johnathan, Granny Smith)
side.instructions:
To boil the sweet potatoes, scrub them but do not peel them or cut them up. Let them cool and then peel them. Alternatively, you can bake them, let them cool, and then peel them.
Preheat the oven to 350°F. Butter a 1 1/2 quart baking dish. Put half the potatoes in the dish. Cover with half the apples, sprinkle with half the sugar, dot with half the butter, sprinkle with salt. Repeat layers.
Cover and bake for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake 30 minutes more or until apples are soft.

salad.title: 24-hour Layered Salad
salad.instructions: Put all ingredients in a large bowl in the order listed, ending with the mayo spread evenly across the top. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 24 hours.
ingredients: 1 1/2 Quart shredded lettuce, sprinkled with salt, pepper, and sugar
1 10 oz package frozen peas, thawed and drained

salad.title: Dad’s Favorite Cucumber Salad
salad.instructions: Slice a large cucumber, sprinkle with pepper, and cover with vinegar. Refrigerate at least an hour before serving.

salad.title: Hot German Potato Salad
salad.instructions: Fry the bacon, saving 1/3 C of the bacon grease. Brown the sliced onion for 2 minutes in the grease, then add the vinegar, water, flour, sugar, salt and pepper, celery seed, and parsley. Cook until thick, then add the cubed potatoes and heat through. Serve.
ingredients: 1 1/2 lbs potatoes, cooked until almost done, then cubed (no need to peel them if you use red or Yukon gold potatoes)

salad.title: Mom’s Potato Salad
salad.instructions:
Place the potatoes in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a simmer and cook until tender (usually about 10 minutes, depending on how big the pieces are). Drain and place in a large mixing bowl. Sprinkle with the vinegar, folding together, then allow them to cool.
Add the onion, eggs, and celery to the bowl. Fold in the mayo, mustard, celery seed, salt and pepper to taste. Serve!
It should last for a couple of days in the fridge, if there are any leftovers.
ingredients: 2 lbs small red potatoes, scrubbed and cut into large bite-size pieces (don’t peel)
3 large eggs, hard boiled and chopped

salad.title: Grandma Hiller’s Wilted Lettuce Salad
ingredients: 4 slices bacon, diced and fried crisp (save the bacon grease for the dressing)
salad.instructions: Add vinegar, salt, pepper, and sugar to bacon grease and heat. Pour the hot grease over the lettuce and onion, toss until wilted, and top with fried bacon.

miscellaneous.title: Garlic Infused Olive Oil
miscellaneous.description: In the US, you can opt to buy Colavita garlic olive oil (Costco often has it), Boyajian Garlic Oil (World Market, 8 oz for about $6), or La Tourangelle garlic infused sunflower oil (Amazon, and in stores in California, for about $6). Target has one under their Good and Tasty brand, but there is no way of knowing whether it’s truly “infused,” which is important).
miscellaneous.instructions:
Sterilize a glass jar or container with boiling water, allow to air dry and set aside. You’ll use this to store the oil.
Peel the garlic cloves and cut each clove in half.
Heat the oil over low heat, until it is warm but not too hot to touch. You don’t want to overheat the oil as this will degrade the oil and change the flavor. Turn off the heat and add the garlic cloves. Allow the oil to infuse for 2 hours. Strain the oil into the clean jar. Make sure you remove all of the garlic pieces.
Use within 3 days (to avoid risk of botulism) or freeze in 1 to 2 T servings in an ice cube tray and use within 3 months.
ingredients: 2 cups of cooking oil (e.g. olive oil, canola oil, grapeseed oil, sunflower oil)
8 cloves of garlic (peeled and cut in half)

miscellaneous.title: Salt Dough Christmas Tree Ornaments
miscellaneous.description: This is the recipe we used for our homemade “cookie” tree ornaments.
miscellaneous.instructions:
Preheat the oven to 275°F.
In a medium bowl, combine ingredients and knead until dough feels smooth and firm. Add more flour if dough feels too sticky or more water if dough feels too dry and crumbly. Keep dough covered until used.
Roll out on lightly floured wax paper and cut. Punch hole in top to allow for an ornament hanger (the actual hanger is added after baking the dough). Bake for 1 hour or until the dough is hard. When dry, decorate with paints, markers, or just varnish. Let dry. 
Once dry, add a yarn or twine ornament hanger.

miscellaneous.title: Peanut Butter Dog Biscuits
ingredients: 1 C natural peanut butter (no added sugar)
miscellaneous.instructions: Mix, then roll out and cut. Bake at 375°F for 20 minutes.

miscellaneous.title: Play Dough
miscellaneous.instructions: Combine all ingredients and cook over medium heat until mixture pulls away from the sides of the pan and becomes like play dough in consistency. Knead until cool. Keeps unrefrigerated for 3 months.
